main event: A UFO sighting was reported near Alexandria, Va on 28 December 1951, involving a generally round object with a hazy truncated cone on top, emitting blue-white soft light, and displaying unconventional maneuvers.
interesting points: The object was initially reported as stationary at 7,000 ft, then moved SSW, NW for 10 miles, and then in an arc SE to E to N to NW before disappearing while observers were adjusting fuel tanks.
Pilots reported the object as perfectly normal, technical, and unidentifiable as belonging to the U.S. Air Force.
No physical evidence or trail/exhaust was observed, and the sound was not heard during the 15-minute observation.
The object was also observed by another pilot, who described it as a spheroid with faint yellowish cast, moving about and hovering like a helicopter, and capable of rapid maneuvers.
The eventual conclusion was that the sighting was likely a helicopter from the Patuxent Naval Air Station with an experimental lighting system.
sighted object: a generally round object with a hazy truncated cone on top, emitting blue-white soft light
